results.title: Through the rip
results.creator_credit: Film Victoria, Edward McQueen-Mason and Terry McMahon
results.brief_description: Traces the long and colourful history of the pilot service operating through The Rip at the entrance of Port Phillip Bay. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Through the olive trees
results.creator_credit: Abbas Kiarostami Prod, Farabi Cinema Foundation and Abbas Kiarostami
results.brief_description: Iranian cinema in the last two decades of the twentieth century has proved to be one of few national cinemas offering an alternative to the dominance of Hollywood, both in terms of production and in terms of aesthetics. Kiarostami is one of the leading directors of post-revolutionary Iranian cinema and his work is intimately concerned with both the nature of human relationships and the power of cinema to influence and transform life. A film crew arrives in a small town devastated by a recent earthquake. Hossein, a young and homeless bricklayer is given a small role as a newly wed husband. The woman who is to play his wife is Tahereh, the girl he adores but who refuses to have anything to do with him. As the director attempts to get the two young people to play their roles in the script, Tahereh and Hossein enact their own drama and conflict in front of the camera. From this simple material, Kiarostami explores the tensions between men and women, reality and imagination, film and politics, and allows us as an audience to explore the ability of film as an art to seduce us even when it is lying to us. Without the use of special effects, big budgets or imaginary beings, “Through the Olive Trees” transports us to a magical world of human drama that Hollywood could not possibly emulate, no matter how much money or technology lies at its disposal.

results.title: Through the looking glass
results.creator_credit: Jambre Productions and Burbank Animation Sydney (Jointly)
results.brief_description: Alice has fallen through her mirror into a wonderful place called Chessland! There Tom Fool, the plucky magician, introduces her to the eccentric White Queen. Alice wants to be Queen too! However, first she must travel across 8 crazy squares of Chessland hitching rides on flying horses and trains that swim.

results.title: Through the eyes of Forrest Gump
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, William Rus and Peyton Reed
results.brief_description: ‘Forest Gump’ won audiences over with it’s universal theme of the underdog who triumphs in the face of adversity, carefully intercut with definitive moments in American history. This program provides a behind the scenes look at how director Robert Zemeckis and his team of special effects artist created the illusion of past and present meeting - such as when Forest meets several U.S. presidents, as well as the special effects involved in recreating the anti-war demonstration, the ping pong game, Lt. Dan’s amputated body and the hurricane. Interviews are provided with cast members Tom Hanks, Robin Wright, Gary Sinise, Mykelti Williamson, Sally Field and Michael Humphreys.

results.title: Through the eyes of a child (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A shopping expedition seen from a child’s eye level. The mother’s goal is just to shop but the child wants to savour every experience along the way, unaware of the circumstances which make his mother hurry on.

results.title: Through the eyes of a child
results.creator_credit: CTVC, Brenda Crowe and Chris Petit
results.brief_description: Documentary on early childhood development. How does a child make sense of the world and itself in relation to the world? A mother and her child go about their everyday life: shopping trips, play, all seen through the eyes of the child. Interviews with children and adolescents talking about their earliest memories of developing a relationship with the outside world, their fears and fantasies about the world outside their relationship with their mother. How does a child make sense of things like clothes; everyday objects like a teapot and what it’s for are learned through play. Without commentary, through images we see the relationship of this learning and the bearing it has on relationships developed in adolescence.

results.title: Through my eyes: Stradbroke Primary School, South Australia (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Timothy Read and Donald Crombie
results.brief_description: Aims to show how open plan school design and method offers greater scope for flexibility in teaching approaches at the infants school level. Designed primarily for in-service use by informed teacher audiences.

results.title: Through my eyes: Kilkenny Primary School, South Australia
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Timothy Read and Donald Crombie
results.brief_description: Kilkenny Primary School is an open-plan school in Adelaide. A bright decor with red carpets, a straw covered ceiling, and splashes of bright colors provides the setting for the activities of senior primary pupils and their teachers. The implementation of a team teaching approach, individual and group work, and the integration of activities and ideas are illustrated in the film. (Teacher education)
